title: Congress
description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

entries.title: The ‘big mistake’ Republican senators want to avoid after Trump’s conviction
entries.description: On both sides of the Capitol, most Republicans say former President Donald Trump’s criminal conviction in New York is politically motivated rather than a substantive case. And the GOP racked in fundraising after Trump was found guilty. Yet just as...

entries.title: Date for Netanyahu address to Congress still up in the air
entries.description: Congressional leaders are still working to finalize a date for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to deliver a joint address to Congress, according to Speaker Mike Johnson's office.  That comes after a person familiar with the planning...

entries.title: ‘Now he’s seen as a symbol’: Republicans rally around Trump
entries.description: Republicans embraced Trump as both parties — and pollsters — tried to gauge the impact of the verdict on the election.

entries.title: Netanyahu accepts Congress‘ invitation to speak despite blowback
entries.description: Tensions have been mounting in recent weeks after Speaker Mike Johnson announced his plan to invite Netanyahu to address Congress.

entries.title: AIPAC ramps up attack on Jamaal Bowman with ads on antisemitism
entries.description: A new ad by the pro-Israel group’s super PAC features the son of Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel openly criticizing Bowman.

entries.title: Lawmakers up pressure on Biden to change struggling Sudan policy
entries.description: “There is no evidence that U.S. policy is working,” said Michelle Gavin, former U.S. ambassador to Botswana.

entries.title: Hill leaders officially invite Netanyahu to speak before Congress
entries.description: Congressional leaders have officially invited Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to speak before Congress, capping off weeks of behind-the-scenes negotiations. The invitation, sent in a Friday letter, doesn’t state when Netanyahu will...

entries.title: Eight Senate Republicans vow to oppose all Biden nominees, Democratic legislation
entries.description: Eight Senate Republicans, led by Mike Lee (R-Utah), are vowing to oppose major legislation and Biden nominees led by the Democratic Senate, following guilty verdicts for former President Donald Trump in New York. The move could further bring...

entries.title: Manchin registering as independent in West Virginia
entries.description: Sen. Joe Manchin is registering as an independent, according to a person familiar with the matter — a move that is sure to stoke speculation he could run for Senate or governor without a party affiliation this fall.A longtime Democrat, Manchin’s...

entries.title: Johnson in Trump verdict aftermath: 'I do believe the Supreme Court should step in'
entries.description: Speaker Mike Johnson said the Supreme Court should "step in" in the aftermath of guilty verdicts for former President Donald Trump on dozens of felony counts in New York.  "I do believe the Supreme Court should step in," Johnson said on Fox News'...

entries.title: Hill GOP blasts 'travesty' Trump verdict — and vows it will motivate party base in November
entries.description: Underscoring the link between their fury over his conviction and their Election Day hopes, some Republicans posted a Trump fundraising link alongside their statements of support.

entries.title: Supreme Court chief justice declines meeting with Dems amid Alito ethics flap
entries.description: Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts has declined a meeting request from two senior Senate Democrats amid a swirl of ethics questions surrounding the conduct of Justice Samuel Alito and, predating that flap, Justice Clarence Thomas. In a...

entries.title: Top Senate Armed Services Republican pushes massive hike in defense spending
entries.description: Sen. Roger Wicker, the top Republican on the Armed Services Committee, is pushing an aggressive plan to build up the Pentagon budget, a blueprint he says is the “generational investment” needed to keep pace with worldwide threats. As part of the...

entries.title: Appeals court nixes bids to force transparency from Congress
entries.description: A federal appeals court ruled Tuesday against two attempts to use the federal courts to force Congress to comply with access requests for records about official activities. In a pair of unanimous opinions, the same three-judge D.C. Circuit Court...

entries.title: AIPAC offshoot spending heavily to beat Cori Bush in her primary
entries.description: Pro-Israel groups are going all-out in a bid to dethrone a member of the House’s liberal Squad, Rep. Cori Bush (D-Mo.), ahead of her Aug. 6 primary battle. Data tracked by AdImpact show approximately $320,000 in ad reservations for cable, radio,...

entries.title: Trump endorses GOP challenger to Freedom Caucus leader
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump officially endorsed Rep. Bob Good’s primary challenger Tuesday morning, a huge potential liability for the chair of the House Freedom Caucus. In a social media post, Trump called Good “BAD FOR VIRGINIA AND BAD FOR THE...

entries.title: ‘We might as well call them the Harry Potter Ministry of Magic’
entries.description: The arrest warrants from the ICC were because of political pressure, Rep. Jared Moskowitz said.

entries.title: Lawmakers say legislation needed to sustain migrant drop
entries.description: “This is just Mexico carrying Biden a couple rounds,” Rep. Tony Gonzales said.

entries.title: Hill GOP urges Trump to consider a running mate with center-right appeal — maybe even Haley
entries.description: Rep. Ryan Zinke (R-Mont.) advised Trump to look at a VP pick who "really reflects areas where he needs to be more competitive to win.”

entries.title: Why Senate conservatives are taking a populist turn
entries.description: During the Obama years, conservatives were all about forcing fodder for the national GOP base onto the Senate’s legislative fights. Recall former Sen. David Vitter’s (R-La.) push to throw Congress onto the Affordable Care Act exchanges, former Sen....

entries.title: Top Senate Judiciary Democrats seek meeting with Roberts over Alito concerns
entries.description: Two senior Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee, including Chair Dick Durbin (D-Ill.), are requesting a meeting with Chief Justice John Roberts "as soon as possible" amid reports that properties owned by Justice Samuel Alito displayed two...

entries.title: Senate border vote fails again, losing support from both sides
entries.description: Chuck Schumer’s second attempt to advance a sweeping border package failed by a wider margin than the first time, with increased opposition among both Republicans and Democrats. Senate campaign arms have already been hitting the other side on the...

entries.title: Scott’s aim to succeed McConnell disrupts GOP leadership race
entries.description: Rick Scott’s entry into the battle for GOP leader has scrambled the generally sleepy race, testing his rivals’ ties to Mitch McConnell and putting a heavier Trump focus on the November contest. Scott’s bid is not a surprise, especially given his...

entries.title: Dozens of House Democrats join most Republicans in passing sweeping crypto bill
entries.description: The cryptocurrency industry capped a notable month on Capitol Hill, as 71 House Democrats joined most Republicans to pass sweeping legislation aimed at establishing rules of the road for the fast-moving industry. Backers of the legislation, which...

entries.title: House GOP tries to defuse its Louisiana primary problem
entries.description: Republicans are openly trying to convince Rep. Garret Graves not to challenge his Louisiana GOP colleagues, fearing another ugly member-on-member fight in a state packed with House leaders. Graves has kept his options open, and he’s facing a...

entries.title: Rick Scott announces bid for Senate GOP leader
entries.description: Florida GOP Sen. Rick Scott launched a bid Wednesday afternoon to succeed Mitch McConnell as the next Republican leader, telling colleagues he wants to make “dramatic change” in the way the conference operates. The first-term senator will face an...

entries.title: Hill leaders discussing details of expected Netanyahu address
entries.description: Senior leaders in both parties are working to finalize an invitation for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to address Congress — but it may not happen as soon as Speaker Mike Johnson would prefer. “The four leaders are working it out,”...

entries.title: House panel advances alternate bill to undo Biden’s Israel weapons pause
entries.description: The House Foreign Affairs Committee on Wednesday advanced a bill that would let Congress force the Biden administration to transfer stalled arms to Israel. The new bill, which is a narrower rebuke of President Joe Biden than the bill that the...

entries.title: ‘Facing 88 felony counts’: Dem's comments on Trump trial prompt faceoff on House floor
entries.description: House Republicans got into a protracted floor fight with Democratic Rep. Jim McGovern, who refused to take back comments he made about former President Donald Trump’s ongoing criminal trial in New York. “Donald Trump might want to be a king, but...

entries.title: Schumer tees up vote on bill to protect contraception after Trump comments
entries.description: The Senate will take up a bill to protect access to contraception in June, Majority Leader Chuck Schumer announced Wednesday, shortly after a Donald Trump interview aired that indicated the presumptive GOP presidential nominee was considering...
